data.name: Text_UpdateAvailable
data.value: A new version of Servy is available. Do you want to download it?

data.name: Text_About
Info_ServiceDisplayName
data.value: The human-readable name shown in the Windows Services console (services.msc). If left empty, the service name will be used instead.

data.name: Info_ProcessParameters
data.value: Process parameters support environment variable expansion. Example: --param="%ProgramData%\MyApp" --param="%MY_VAR%\bin"

data.name: Info_DateRotation
data.value: When both size-based and date-based rotation are enabled, size rotation takes precedence.

data.name: Info_MaxRotations
data.value: Maximum rotated log files to keep. Set to 0 for unlimited.

data.name: Msg_InvalidMaxRotations
data.value: Max rotations must be a number greater than or equal to 0.

data.name: Info_RecoveryAction
data.value: Restart service and restart computer actions are not available if the service runs under NT AUTHORITY\NetworkService, NT AUTHORITY\LocalService, or a user account without the required privileges. Only the restart process action will be available for these accounts.

data.name: Info_FailureProgram
data.value: Configure a script or executable to run when the process fails to start. If health monitoring is disabled, the program will run when the process fails to start. If health monitoring is enabled, the program will only run after all configured recovery action retries have failed.

data.name: Info_FailureProgramStartupDirectory
data.value: Optional. Defaults to the failure program directory.

data.name: Msg_InvalidFailureProgramPath
data.value: The failure program path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidFailureProgramStartupDirectory
data.value: The specified failure program startup directory is invalid.

data.name: Info_EnvironmentVariables
data.value: Enter variables in the format varName=varValue, one per line or separated by semicolons (;). Use \= to escape '=', \" to escape '"', \; to escape ';' and \\ to escape '\'. Supports environment variable expansion, example: VAR1=%ProgramData%\MyApp; VAR2=%VAR1%\bin

data.name: Info_ServiceDependencies
data.value: Specify one or more Windows service names (not display names) that this service depends on. Enter each service name on a new line or separate them with semicolons (;). Use service key names without spaces or special characters. Each dependency service must be installed and running before this service can start. If a dependency's start type is Automatic, Windows will try to start it automatically before this service. If a dependency fails to start or is disabled, this service will not start.

data.name: Info_UserAccount
data.value: The service account username (e.g., .\username, DOMAIN\username, or DOMAIN\gMSA$).

data.name: Info_UserAccountRights
data.value: If the service runs under an account other than Local System, NT AUTHORITY\NetworkService, or NT AUTHORITY\LocalService, make sure to grant write access to %ProgramData%\Servy for the account running the service.

data.name: Info_PreLaunch
data.value: Configure an optional script or executable to run before the main service starts. This is useful for preparing configurations, fetching secrets, or other setup tasks. If the pre-launch script fails, the service will not start unless you enable "Ignore Failure".

data.name: Info_PreLaunchStartupDirectory
data.value: Optional. Defaults to the service working directory.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPreLaunchPath
data.value: The pre-launch process path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPreLaunchStartupDirectory
data.value: The specified pre-launch startup directory is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPreLaunchStdoutPath
data.value: The specified pre-launch stdout file path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPreLaunchStderrPath
data.value: The specified pre-launch stderr file path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPreLaunchTimeout
data.value: Pre-Launch timeout must be a number of seconds greater than or equal to 5 seconds.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPreLaunchRetryAttempts
data.value: Pre-Launch retry attempts must be a number greater than or equal to 0.

data.name: Msg_FailedToLoadXml
data.value: Failed to load XML service configuration.

data.name: Msg_FailedToLoadJson
data.value: Failed to load JSON service configuration.

data.name: Confirm_ClearAll
data.value: Are you sure you want to clear all configuration values?

data.name: Msg_ValidationError
data.value: Please fill in all required fields.

data.name: Msg_ServiceNameError
data.value: A service name is required to perform this action.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPath
data.value: The specified process path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidStartupDirectory
data.value: The specified startup directory is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidStdoutPath
data.value: The specified stdout file path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidStderrPath
data.value: The specified stderr file path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidRotationSize
data.value: Rotation size must be specified in megabytes (MB) and be greater than or equal to 1 MB.

data.name: Msg_InvalidHeartbeatInterval
data.value: Heartbeat interval must be a number of seconds greater than or equal to 5 seconds.

data.name: Msg_InvalidMaxFailedChecks
data.value: Max Failed Checks must be a number greater than or equal to 1.

data.name: Msg_InvalidMaxRestartAttempts
data.value: Max Restart Attempts must be a number greater than or equal to 1.

data.name: Msg_ServiceAlreadyExists
data.value:
A service with this name already exists. Would you like to replace it?
If the service is disabled and marked for deletion, the installation will fail until you restart your PC.

data.name: Msg_ServiceDisabled
data.value: A disabled service with this name already exists. Choose a different name.

data.name: Msg_ServiceNotFound
data.value: The specified service was not found.

data.name: Info_PostLaunch
data.value: Configure an optional script or executable to run after the process starts successfully.

data.name: Info_PostLaunchStartupDirectory
data.value: Optional. If not set, defaults to the directory of the post-launch program.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPostLaunchPath
data.value: The post-launch process path is invalid.

data.name: Msg_InvalidPostLaunchStartupDirectory
data.value: The specified post-launch startup directory is invalid.

data.name: Info_EnableDebugLogs
data.value: When enabled, environment variables and process parameters are recorded in the Windows Event Log. Not recommended for production environments, as these logs may contain sensitive information.

data.name: Info_StartTimeout
data.value: The timeout in seconds to wait for the process to start successfully before considering the startup as failed.

data.name: Msg_InvalidStartTimeout
data.value: Start timeout must be a number greater than or equal to 1.

data.name: Info_StopTimeout
data.value: The timeout in seconds to wait for the process to exit.

data.name: Msg_InvalidStopTimeout
data.value: Stop timeout must be a number greater than or equal to 1.
